ul.li1: 1Hear the word of Yahweh, O children of Israel,
for Yahweh has an indictment against the inhabitants of the land.
There is no faithfulness or loyalty,
ul.li2: there is no knowledge of God in the land.
ul.li1: 2Swearing and lying,
ul.li2: murdering and stealing,
ul.li3: and adultery break out,The LXX adds “and adultery breaks out in the land”
ul.li2: and bloodshed follows bloodshed.
ul.li1: 3Therefore the land mourns,
ul.li2: and all those living in it languish
ul.li1: with the animals of the field,
ul.li2: and the birds of the heaven,
and even the fish of the sea
ul.li1: 4Yet, let no one contend,
ul.li2: and let no one accuse,
ul.li1: for with you, O priest, is my contention.The Hebrew is unclear; the NASB translates “For your people are like those who contend with the priest”
5You will stumble by day,
ul.li2: and the priest also will stumble
ul.li1: And I will destroy your mother;
ul.li2: 6My people are destroyed
ul.li1: because you have rejected knowledge,
ul.li2: I reject you from acting as a priest for me.Or “to me”
ul.li1: And since you have forgotten the law of your God,
ul.li2: I will also forget your children.Hebrew “sons”
ul.li1: 7When they became many, their sin increased against me;
ul.li2: they changedHebrew uncertain; MT “I will exchange” their glory into shame.
ul.li1: 8They feed on the sin of my people,Literally “They eat the sins of my people”
ul.li2: they are greedyLiterally “they lift up their throat” for their iniquity.
ul.li1: 9And it will be like people, like priest;
I will punish themHebrew “him” for theirHebrew “his” ways,
ul.li2: and I will requite themHebrew “him” for theirHebrew “his” deeds.
ul.li1: 10They will eat and not be satisfied;
ul.li2: they will play the whore and not multiply,
ul.li1: because they have forsaken Yahweh to devote themselves to
ul.li2: 11whoredom.Literally “to watch over whoredom”
ul.li1: Wine and new wine take away the understanding.Literally “take away heart”
ul.li2: 12My people,
ul.li1: consult their wooden idols,Literally “their wood”
ul.li2: and their divining rod gives them oracles;
ul.li1: because a spirit of whoredom led them astray,
ul.li2: and they played the whore from under their God.That is, “they played the whore forsaking their God”; See Ezek 23:5
ul.li1: 13On the tops of the mountains they sacrifice,
ul.li2: and on the hills they make offerings,
ul.li1: under oak, poplar, and terebinth,
ul.li2: because theirHebrew “its” shade is good.
ul.li1: Therefore your daughters play the whore,
ul.li2: and all your daughters-in-lawOr “brides” commit adultery.
ul.li1: 14I will not punish your daughtersLiterally “I will not visit sins upon your daughters” when they play the whore,
ul.li2: or your daughters-in-lawOr “brides” when they commit adultery;
ul.li1: because they go aside with whores,
ul.li2: and they sacrifice with temple prostitutes,
ul.li3: a people that does not understand comes to ruin.
ul.li1: 15Even though you, O Israel, are playing the whore,
ul.li2: do not let Judah become guilty;
ul.li1: do not enter Gilgal,
ul.li2: or go up to Beth-aven;
ul.li1: and do not swear,
ul.li2: “As Yahweh lives!”Literally “the life of Yahweh”
ul.li1: 16Indeed, like a stubborn heifer,
ul.li2: Israel is stubborn;
ul.li1: Now Yahweh will feed them,
ul.li2: like a lamb in broad pasture.Or “Can Yahweh feed them, like a lamb in broad pasture?”
ul.li1: 17Ephraim is joined to idols;
ul.li2: let him alone.
ul.li1: 18When their drinking has ended,
ul.li2: they surely indulge in sexual orgies.
They love lewdness more than theirHebrew “her” glory.
ul.li1: 19A wind has wrapped themHebrew “her” in its wings,
ul.li2: and they will be ashamed because of their altars.
